hanzi-su-wiki:
紳

Значения

Благородный

Мнемоника

Широкий нитяной 糸 пояс людей благородного звания и высокого ранга. Знак 申 означает «тянуть», т.е. удерживать.

Варианты

绅

(Simplified: 绅)
Pictophonetic: 申 indicates the sound; 糹 (silk) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 紳士 [ shēn shì ]: gentleman
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 申 [ shēn ] to report; to extend; to explain; to declare
heisig_chinese_memo: Monkeys are very adept at swinging around trees. But when they met Spiderman, who could swing around even better than they could, they all quickly addressed him as sire, a member of the gentry.
heisig_constituent: sire, thread, spiderman, monkey, sun, day, stick
koohiiStory1: Monkeys are very adept at swinging around trees. But when they met Spiderman, who could swing around even better than they could, they all quickly addressed him as sire.
koohiiStory2: From the fairy tale ‘emperor’s new clothes.’ sire, i know you say it's made of the finest threads, but i’m afraid someone has made a monkey of you.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your threads are humble and that makes you a perfect gentleman. You don't have to have fancy clothes to be a gentleman, just humble ones that don't stand out and show off too much. That shows how polite you are.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself as the perfect gentleman. You may not have a fancy top hat and tie, but you're humble about what you wear and you're kind to everyone.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately, as a gentleman who dresses humbly, you're always getting kicked in the shins (しん) by rude kids (and occasionally rude adults).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: But you're a gentleman, so you don't kick their shins back, you smile and hold in the pain. No matter how bad your shins hurt, you never fight back!
Ru_Radicals: ｜, 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 日 (день), 田 (рисовое поле), 糸 (нить)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) says (申) he's a gentleman
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The monkey sees how well Spidey can move like him and immediately respects him as a member of the gentry.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "糸", "申", the original meaning is the ancient scholar-officials tied around their waists, with one end hanging down. "Shuowen": "Large belt. Congshi, Shensheng." "The Analects of Confucius. Wei Linggong": "Zhang Shu and the gentry." Xing Bingshu: "This belt is girded and hung down as an ornament. gentry."

" Gentry " can mean restraint. "Han Feizi·Foreign Chu said on the upper left": "The book says: "The gentry is bound by it." There are rulers in the Song Dynasty, and the gentry is bound by the gentry because of the heavy belt."

" Gentry " also refers to a person who binds a gentry, a gentleman. Song Yueke "Shishi‧Zichenlang Food": "When I was in Bianjing, the grass was ignorant in the sky, and I would like to feast on the court gentry for the long Spring Festival one day."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "糸", "申", the original meaning is the ancient literati and official with a big drooping belt tied around his waist.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「申」聲，本義為古代士大夫束於腰間，一頭下垂的大帶。《說文》：「大帶也。从糸，申聲。」《論語‧衛靈公》：「子張書諸紳。」邢昺疏：「此帶束腰，垂其餘以為飾，謂之紳。」

　　「紳」可表示約束。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「書曰：『紳之束之。』宋人有治者，因重帶自紳束也。」

　　「紳」還指束紳的人士、紳士。宋岳珂《桯史‧紫宸廊食》：「在汴京時，天造草昧，一日長春節，欲盡宴廷紳。」
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「申」聲，本義為古代士大夫束於腰間，一頭下垂的大帶。

①古代士大夫束腰的大帶子，引申爲束紳的人：紳束(用帶子束腰，喻約束)。縉紳(舊時高官的裝束，轉用爲官宦的代稱)。
②舊稱地方上有勢力、有地位的人：紳士。鄉紳。官紳。土豪劣紳。

紳士(しんし): gentleman

從「 糸 」，「 申 」聲，本義為古代士大夫束於腰間，一頭下垂的大帶。《說文》：「大帶也。从糸，申聲。」《論語‧衛靈公》：「子張書諸紳。」邢昺疏：「此帶束腰，垂其餘以為飾，謂之紳。」 「 紳 」可表示約束。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「書曰：『紳之束之。』宋人有治者，因重帶自紳束也。」 「 紳 」還指束紳的人士、紳士。宋岳珂《桯史‧紫宸廊食》：「在汴京時，天造草昧，一日長春節，欲盡宴廷紳。」
From the sound of " 糸", " 申", the original meaning is the ancient scholar-officials tied around their waists, with one end hanging down. "Shuowen": "Large belt. Congshi, Shensheng." "The Analects of Confucius. Wei Linggong": "Zhang Shu and the gentry." Xing Bingshu: "This belt is girded and hung down as an ornament. gentry." " Gentry" can mean restraint. "Han Feizi·Foreign Chu said on the upper left": "The book says: "The gentry is bound by it." There are rulers in the Song Dynasty, and the gentry is bound by the gentry because of the heavy belt." " Gentry" also refers to a person who binds a gentry, a gentleman. Song Yueke "Shishi‧Zichenlang Food": "When I was in Bianjing, the grass was ignorant in the sky, and I would like to feast on the court gentry for the long Spring Festival one day."

紳字的基本解释

紳
shēn
见“绅”。

紳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shēn］
［《廣韻》失人切，平真，書。］
“绅1”的繁体字。
(1)古代士大夫束于腰间，一头下垂的大带。
(2)约束。
(3)指束绅的人士，绅士。

紳字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　紳； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页920第02
【廣韻】失人切【集韻】【正韻】升人切，?音申。【說文】大帶也。【禮·內則】冠緌纓端，韠紳縉笏。【註】紳，大帶，所以自紳約也。【論語】子張書諸紳。【疏】以帶束腰，垂其餘以爲飾，謂之紳。　又【博雅】紳，束也。　又【韻補】叶尸連切【韓愈·謝自然詩】奈何不自信，反欲從物遷。感傷遂成詠，昧者宜書紳。

shēn
вм. 绅
Radicals: 糸, 申  (thread, humble)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your threads are humble and that makes you a perfect gentleman. You don't have to have fancy clothes to be a gentleman, just humble ones that don't stand out and show off too much. That shows how polite you are.
Picture yourself as the perfect gentleman. You may not have a fancy top hat and tie, but you're humble about what you wear and you're kind to everyone.
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately, as a gentleman who dresses humbly, you're always getting kicked in the shins (しん) by rude kids (and occasionally rude adults).
But you're a gentleman, so you don't kick their shins back, you smile and hold in the pain. No matter how bad your shins hurt, you never fight back!
